alert.note: Alert for Grand; San Juan (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 9:11PM MDT until August 11 at 11:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Grand County in east central Utah... Northern San Juan County in southeastern Utah... * Until 1130 PM MDT. * At 911 PM MDT, Doppler radar and gauge readings indicated thunderstorms had produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing with water still moving swiftly through the Pack and Mill Creek drainages. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Moab and Spanish Valley. This includes the following streams and drainages... Mill Creek and Pack Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
